FacilityName: Farmers Union Oil Company of Rugby

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies.
We at the Farmers Union Oil Company at Rugby, ND are strongly committed to employee, public, and environment safety. This commitment is an inherent part of our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. We coordinate our response efforts with the Rugby Fire Department which provides additional emergency response expertise.

2. Stationary source and regulated substances handled
Our facilities sole activities include support services to crop protection. We have ammonia stored in two 30,000 gallon tanks, 4- 2000 gallon nurse tanks, 3-1450 gallon nurse tanks, and 32-1000 gallon nurse tanks at our facility in Rugby, ND. 

3. Worst case release and alternative release scenarios. (NOTE: available only to county officials, fire department and Farmers Union Oil Company.)

4. Accidental release prevention program
Our facility has taken all necessary steps to comply with the EPA's accidental release requirements as set forth in 40 CFR part 68 subpart C. 

5. Five year accidental history
Farmers Union Oil Company has had an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years and beyond. Due to our stringent release prevention policies, no accidental release has occurred during this period.

6. Emergency Response Plan
Farmers Union Oil Company maintains a written emergency action plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan addresses all aspects of emergency response including aid and medical treatment if necessary. This plan is coordinated and reviewed with the Rugby Fire Department on an annual basis. The plan is intended for response agencies to address all aspects of emergency response.

7. Planned changes to improve safety
We will continue to provide our employees with ongoing annual training to ensure th
at they are current with all of the safe handling of ammonia tranfers and procedures, and provide regular maintenance checks on all ammonia equipment as needed.
